story.storykicker: Haryana college admissions to begin from June 5, 2016.
story.storybody:
Haryana Education Minister Ram Bilas Sharma on Wednesday, June 01, 2016 revealed that admission in all government colleges in the state would commence from June 5 to 30. He further said that students of undergraduate and postgraduate courses would be issued a single roll number.

According to PTI, the admission schedule of all government colleges has been notified for the 2016-17 session. The online admission would be conducted from June 5 to 30, Sharma said.

Points brought to the fore by the minister:

  • With effect from the academic session 2016-17, the roll numbers of the students getting admissions in first year of under-graduate and post-graduate courses would be auto-generated by the system
  • The roll numbers of only those students would be generated who successfully deposit the fee
  • The applicants would fill up application form online in the college free of cost and the college principal would be authorised to approve five to ten local vendors or cyber cafes at the approved single rate (lowest rate) as per government procedure
  • The rate would not exceed by Rs 50 per form, as authorised in 2015-16, he informed
  • All candidates would be informed about successful activities through an SMS
  • "No old student needs to fill up the form online for 2016-17," he added
  • He said that all the principals were authorised to have Internet Lease Line, as approved last year, up to a limit of Rs 1.5 lakh
  • All the colleges should ensure that the merit lists are pasted on the notice boards and uploaded on college website
  • "It would be mandatory for candidates to submit the hard copy of admission form along with all required documents at college counter till 4 pm on June 30, 2016," he said.
  • The Minister further said that all principals have been directed to check and verify subjects offered by the college along with the subject combinations, number of seats in each course as well as the percentage of cut-off for each course and the fee structure of each course and class.
